column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////The usual order consists of: Malnati Chicago classic
column3: and calamari. What makes Lou's deep dish better than others is it's not overly stuffed. The sausage is lean and not overly salty as it carelessly rests on a bed of vine-ripened tomatoes. One can easily down two slices without feeling too guilty unless you also ordered appetizers. The calamari was standard
column5: and seasoned. It delight to have but I would not say it's a must-order. As for the salad
column7: when I go for deep dish
column8: I'm not looking for a healthy meal. I mainly ordered it so as to not further provoke my out-of-country friends into thinking what unhealthy and detrimental eating habits Americans have.
